result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Bervis Deon Sallis in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Bervis Deon Sallis in custody.  Lucy Kronforst for Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Amy Hempe-Franklin Police Department Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests. 

Upon oral motion by the State, Court amends COUNT 1:MISDEMEANOR RETAIL THEFT, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.50 (1m) (d), a Class A Misdemeanor.  
Case is reassigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 07.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference on June 19, 2014 at 8:30 a.m. in Branch 07.  (Pretrial date given by Deputy Court Clerk in Br 07.)

Defense Counsel did not enter a plea on on behalf of the defendant.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TARGET, 7100 SOUTH LOVERS LANE RD./ANTONIO J. (CO-ACTOR)/JOHN T. (CO-ACTOR).

Defendant Bervis Deon Sallis in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Bervis Deon Sallis in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge YAMAHIRO, Branch 34.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Bervis Deon Sallis not in court.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case set for initial appearance.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
